title: Collaborative Problem-Creation Learning Workshop for Mathematics Assessment Item Development

context.prior_knowledge: Understanding of secondary-level mathematics fundamentals (equations, functions, geometry) and problem-solving experience
context.additional_context: Strengthening Capabilities in Developing Mathematics Assessment Items for Corporate Training: Blending Asynchronous Collaboration via BYOD with Offline Workshops

learning_goals: Learners can create multiple-choice math questions following a structured procedure (setting problem scenarios, developing correct/incorrect options, analyzing rationale for correct answers).
Learners can perform a process to improve the validity and discriminatory power of questions through peer feedback and collaboration.
Learners can present a plan to apply developed questions to actual educational assessments as a project deliverable.

resources: Online collaboration platforms (Google Docs, Miro boards)
Math assessment item development guideline template

difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
